Implement GraphitiClient.js adapter for Graphiti API
description:
## Task
Create a GraphitiClient adapter class that provides methods for all Graphiti API operations needed by CodePerceptionModule.

## API Endpoints to Implement

### Entity Operations
- `POST /entity-node` - Upsert entity (file or symbol)
  - Required fields: `uuid`, `group_id`, `name`, `summary`
  - Name normalization happens server-side (`File:src/main.py` → `file_src_main_py`)

### UUID Utilities
- `GET /api/utils/uuid?name=X&group_id=Y` - Pre-calculate deterministic UUID
  - Algorithm: UUID5 with namespace `graphiti.entity.{group_id}`
  - Same name + group_id always produces same UUID
- `GET /api/utils/edge-uuid` - Calculate edge UUID

### Node Updates
- `PATCH /nodes/{uuid}/summary` - Update node summary only
  - Lighter weight than full entity-node upsert

### Maintenance
- `POST /api/tools/prune-missing` - Invalidate deleted files
  - Pass `group_id` and `active_files` array
  - Files NOT in array get marked with `invalid_at` timestamp

### Context (Optional)
- `POST /messages` - Add commit messages as narrative context

## Proposed Interface
```javascript
class GraphitiClient {
  constructor(baseUrl, groupId) {}
  
  // UUID utilities
  async getEntityUUID(name) {}
  async getEdgeUUID(sourceUuid, targetUuid, name) {}
  
  // Entity operations  
  async upsertEntity(uuid, name, summary) {}
  async updateNodeSummary(uuid, summary) {}
  
  // Maintenance
  async pruneDeletedFiles(activeFilePaths) {}
  
  // Context
  async addCommitMessage(message) {}
}
```

## Implementation Notes
- Use existing http.js connection pooling (fetchWithPool)
- Follow pattern from HulyRestClient.js
- Add retry logic for transient failures
- Include batch support for bulk operations (git checkout scenario)

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] All methods implemented and tested
- [ ] Connection pooling configured
- [ ] Error handling with retries
- [ ] JSDoc documentation

Many sync operations are done per-issue sequentially (await per item), sometimes with added delays. This creates high wall time.

- No increased mismatch/duplication.
- Rate limits respected.

## Risks

## Test Plan

title: [BUG] Bidirectional sync creates duplicate issues - Huly issues not visible in Beads
description:
## Problem

When syncing bidirectionally between Beads and Huly, duplicate issues are being created. This indicates that Huly→Beads sync is failing to import existing issues, causing Beads to create new entries for work that already exists in Huly.

## Evidence (from GRAPH project)

| Beads Created | Already Existed | Title | Status |
|---------------|-----------------|-------|--------|
| GRAPH-132 | GRAPH-101 | [P2] Update mutation paths to set updated_at | Done |
| GRAPH-134 | GRAPH-104 | [P2] Update DeltaTracker to use timestamps | Done |
| GRAPH-135 | GRAPH-102 | [P2] Add FalkorDB index on updated_at | Done |
| GRAPH-136 | GRAPH-100 | [P2] Create migration script for existing nodes | Done |
| GRAPH-131 | GRAPH-103 | [P2] Implement incremental fetch in visualizer | Done |
| GRAPH-129 | GRAPH-106 | [P3] Implement Redis Stream consumer in visualizer | Done |
| GRAPH-130 | GRAPH-105 | [P3] Create ChangeEventPublisher class | Done |
| GRAPH-128 | GRAPH-107 | [P3] Integrate publisher into Graphiti mutation paths | Done |

## Root Cause Analysis

Possible causes:
1. Huly→Beads sync failure - Original issues never made it to Beads
2. Beads deduplication failure - Beads received Huly issues but didn't recognize them
3. ID/linking mismatch - Sync not maintaining proper cross-references
4. Timing issue - Beads tasks created before Huly sync completed

## Expected Behavior

- Issues created in Huly should appear in Beads via bd list
- When Beads syncs to Huly, it should check for existing issues
- No duplicate issues should be created

## Suggested Fix

1. Investigate Huly→Beads sync to ensure issues are imported correctly
2. Add deduplication check before creating new Huly issues from Beads
3. Compare issue titles/descriptions to find potential matches
4. If match found (especially if Done), link instead of create new

Add expression block anti-slop guard for PM agents
description:
Add a dedicated expression memory block to all PM agents as an anti-slop guard.

**What**: A separate Letta memory block (label: 'expression') that defines communication style and explicitly bans AI slop patterns.

**Why**: PM persona already has behavioral rules ('NEVER say no rush') but they're buried in 5KB of text. A dedicated expression block makes anti-slop enforcement explicit and enforceable. Inspired by letta-ai/lettabot's persona_expression.mdx pattern.

**Design**:
- Shared base block: anti-slop rules all agents get (no 'certainly!', no 'great question!', no performative warmth)
- Per-agent personality layer: PM agents get terse/action-oriented style, companion agents get different style

title: [Epic] CodePerceptionModule - Real-Time Knowledge Graph Syncer
description:
## Objective
Implement a real-time Code Perception module that watches local project codebases, indexes changes, and pushes structural/semantic definitions to the Graphiti Knowledge Graph.

## Problem
The Graphiti Knowledge Graph becomes stale immediately after code changes. Agents querying the graph for 'Project Architecture' get outdated answers, leading to hallucinations during development tasks.

## Solution
Integrate a Real-Time Code Watcher into VibeSync that:
1. Watches file events (chokidar)
2. Parses code using Tree-sitter (via CocoIndex patterns)
3. Performs atomic upserts to Graphiti EntityNodes representing the code

## Graphiti API Endpoints (Confirmed LIVE)
- `POST /entity-node` - Create/upsert file or symbol entities
- `PATCH /nodes/{uuid}/summary` - Update existing node summaries
- `POST /api/tools/prune-missing` - Soft-delete removed files
- `GET /api/utils/uuid` - Deterministic UUID generation
- `GET /api/utils/edge-uuid` - Edge UUID generation
- `POST /messages` - Add narrative context (commit messages)

## Implementation Phases
1. GraphitiClient adapter (lib/GraphitiClient.js)
2. CodePerceptionWatcher service (lib/CodePerceptionWatcher.js)
3. Configuration and integration
4. Testing and validation

## Success Metrics
- Graph reflects code changes within <5 seconds of file save
- Agent can answer questions about new code immediately
- Zero race conditions during rapid editing

title: Implement CodePerceptionWatcher.js - Real-time code file watcher
description:
## Task
Create a CodePerceptionWatcher service that watches project files and syncs structural/semantic data to Graphiti.

## Architecture
```
FileWatcher (chokidar)
    → Debounce (2s)
    → Parse & Extract (Tree-sitter/regex)
    → Hash Delta Check
    → GraphitiClient API Calls:
        • POST /entity-node (new files/symbols)
        • PATCH /nodes/{uuid}/summary (updates)
        • POST /api/tools/prune-missing (deletes)
```

## Implementation Details

### File Watching
- Extend existing FileWatcher.js pattern
- Use chokidar for file system events
- Debounce 2s to ensure writes are complete
- Respect .gitignore patterns

### Code Parsing
Phase 1: Simple file-level entities
- Entity name: `File:{relative_path}`
- Summary: First N chars of file + language detection

Phase 2 (Future): Symbol extraction
- Parse classes, functions using Tree-sitter
- Create `Symbol:{name}` entities
- Create DEFINES edges from File → Symbol

### Hash Delta Check
- Compute MD5 hash of file content
- Compare with previous sync state
- Skip unchanged files (avoid redundant API calls)

### Burst Protection
- Batch changes during git checkout (1000+ files)
- Chunk POST /entity-node calls (batches of 50)
- Single POST /api/tools/prune-missing at end

## Event Flow
1. Developer saves `src/user_manager.py`
2. chokidar fires FILE_MODIFIED event
3. Wait 2s debounce
4. Parse file, extract summary
5. Check hash - if changed:
   a. Compute UUID: `getEntityUUID('File:src/user_manager.py')`
   b. Call `upsertEntity(uuid, name, summary)`
6. On file delete:
   a. Collect active files
   b. Call `pruneDeletedFiles(activeFiles)`

## Configuration
```javascript
{
  graphiti: {
    enabled: process.env.GRAPHITI_ENABLED === 'true',
    apiUrl: process.env.GRAPHITI_API_URL || 'http://localhost:8003',
    groupId: process.env.GRAPHITI_GROUP_ID, // e.g., 'vibesync_project_huly-vibe-sync'
  },
  codePerception: {
    debounceMs: 2000,
    batchSize: 50,
    maxFileSizeKb: 500,
  }
}
```

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] File add/change/delete events processed correctly
- [ ] Debouncing works (2s window)
- [ ] Hash delta check prevents redundant syncs
- [ ] Burst protection handles git checkout
- [ ] Integration with GraphitiClient works end-to-end
